item.title: Tickets for potential ALCS games go on sale Oct. 1
item.description: Tickets for a potential American League Championship Series at Angel Stadium will go on sale Wednesday, Oct. 1, beginning at 10 a.m. PT, the team announced Friday.
item.content:encoded: Tickets for a potential American League Championship Series at Angel Stadium will go on sale Wednesday, Oct. 1, beginning at 10 a.m. PT, the team announced Friday.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: As playoffs near, Trout not changing his game
item.description: Some would argue that this has been Mike Trout's worst season, but few would say he isn't the AL MVP -- and that's about as indicative of his success as there is.
item.content:encoded: Some would argue that this has been Mike Trout's worst season, but few would say he isn't the AL MVP -- and that's about as indicative of his success as there is.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Angels, Orioles looking great for different reasons
item.description: It seems utterly foolish, if not stupid, to pick against the Angels as baseball's postseason is poised for its unpredictable October run. But the Orioles have been playing like a team of destiny.
item.content:encoded: It seems utterly foolish, if not stupid, to pick against the Angels as baseball's postseason is poised for its unpredictable October run. But the Orioles have been playing like a team of destiny.
item.dc:creator: Hal Bodley

item.title: Weaver, Angels aim to clinch AL's top seed facing Mariners
item.description: With three games left in the regular season, it's still mathematically possible for the Mariners to reach the playoffs, but they have barely any margin for error as they begin a three-game series Friday against the Angels at Safeco Field. Hisashi Iwakuma starts for the Mariners, while Jered Weaver takes the ball for the Angels, who can clinch home field throughout the postseason with a win.
item.content:encoded: With three games left in the regular season, it's still mathematically possible for the Mariners to reach the playoffs, but they have barely any margin for error as they begin a three-game series Friday against the Angels at Safeco Field. Hisashi Iwakuma starts for the Mariners, while Jered Weaver takes the ball for the Angels, who can clinch home field throughout the postseason with a win.
item.dc:creator: Matthew DeFranks

item.title: Angels' magic number at 2 for AL's top seed
item.description: Hector Santiago bounced back with a scoreless outing, Howie Kendrick continued to produce from the cleanup spot and the Angels held on to beat the A's, 5-4, on Wednesday afternoon, taking two of three at O.co Coliseum. With the win, the Angels maintained a 2 1/2-game lead on the Orioles for the best record in the Majors and trimmed their magic number to lock up home-field advantage throughout the postseason to 2.
item.content:encoded: Hector Santiago bounced back with a scoreless outing, Howie Kendrick continued to produce from the cleanup spot and the Angels held on to beat the A's, 5-4, on Wednesday afternoon, taking two of three at O.co Coliseum. With the win, the Angels maintained a 2 1/2-game lead on the Orioles for the best record in the Majors and trimmed their magic number to lock up home-field advantage throughout the postseason to 2.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Trout exits finale vs. A's with stomach illness
item.description: Mike Trout exited Wednesday's 5-4 win over the A's after four innings, but it wasn't because of an injury -- the Angels' superstar center fielder merely had a stomach illness.
item.content:encoded: Mike Trout exited Wednesday's 5-4 win over the A's after four innings, but it wasn't because of an injury -- the Angels' superstar center fielder merely had a stomach illness.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Out call at plate on Donaldson stands in fourth
item.description: Oakland third baseman Josh Donaldson made a nifty move at home plate to try to score from third base on a Derek Norris fly ball in the fourth inning of the Angels' 5-4 win over the A's on Wednesday, but a crew chief review confirmed the original call: out. The review was based on Rule 7.13, which defines how a catcher is allowed to position himself on a play at the plate.
item.content:encoded: Oakland third baseman Josh Donaldson made a nifty move at home plate to try to score from third base on a Derek Norris fly ball in the fourth inning of the Angels' 5-4 win over the A's on Wednesday, but a crew chief review confirmed the original call: out. The review was based on Rule 7.13, which defines how a catcher is allowed to position himself on a play at the plate.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Leibowitz

item.title: Hamilton plans to be ready to play in ALDS
item.description: Josh Hamilton has no doubts about being able to play in next week's American League Division Series, but the Angels' outfielder is leaning toward not playing in the season-ending series in Seattle this weekend to avoid a setback and get some extra rest for the postseason.
item.content:encoded: Josh Hamilton has no doubts about being able to play in next week's American League Division Series, but the Angels' outfielder is leaning toward not playing in the season-ending series in Seattle this weekend to avoid a setback and get some extra rest for the postseason.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Angels' much-improved defense key to success
item.description: The Angels entered their fourth-to-last regular-season game Wednesday with 19 more wins than they had all of last year. And though a deeper bullpen, a dangerous offense and some unexpected starting-pitching contributions have had a lot to do with that, one aspect that shouldn't go overlooked in all of this is defense.
item.content:encoded: The Angels entered their fourth-to-last regular-season game Wednesday with 19 more wins than they had all of last year. And though a deeper bullpen, a dangerous offense and some unexpected starting-pitching contributions have had a lot to do with that, one aspect that shouldn't go overlooked in all of this is defense.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: On 40th birthday, McDonald proud of his longevity
item.description: Angels utility infielder John McDonald is in the final stages of his career now, regardless of whether this ends up being his final season. He turned 40 years old on Wednesday, attaining uncommon longevity without ever possessing dynamic tools.
item.content:encoded: Angels utility infielder John McDonald is in the final stages of his career now, regardless of whether this ends up being his final season. He turned 40 years old on Wednesday, attaining uncommon longevity without ever possessing dynamic tools.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Angels put 'it factor' on display in win over A's
item.description: With Tuesday night's 2-0 victory over the A's and a dominant Sonny Gray, the Angels provided a perfect example of why they have the best record in baseball -- because they know how to find a way to win.
item.content:encoded: With Tuesday night's 2-0 victory over the A's and a dominant Sonny Gray, the Angels provided a perfect example of why they have the best record in baseball -- because they know how to find a way to win.
item.dc:creator: Lyle Spencer

item.title: LeBlanc's gem sends Angels closer to AL's top seed
item.description: Five days after blanking the Mariners through 5 1/3 innings, Wade LeBlanc did the same to the A's at O.co Coliseum on Tuesday night, leading the Angels to a 2-0 victory and putting himself in the mix for a spot on Mike Scioscia's playoff roster.
item.content:encoded: Five days after blanking the Mariners through 5 1/3 innings, Wade LeBlanc did the same to the A's at O.co Coliseum on Tuesday night, leading the Angels to a 2-0 victory and putting himself in the mix for a spot on Mike Scioscia's playoff roster.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Angels may give Rasmus a shot at 2015 rotation
item.description: Injuries early in Cory Rasmus' career prompted a move from starting to the bullpen, but the Angels' 26-year-old right-hander may get a chance to earn a spot in the rotation next season.
item.content:encoded: Injuries early in Cory Rasmus' career prompted a move from starting to the bullpen, but the Angels' 26-year-old right-hander may get a chance to earn a spot in the rotation next season.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Trout meets Griffey to tape FOX Sports 1 show
item.description: Mike Trout and Ken Griffey Jr. sat down for about a half hour at one of the family rooms at O.co Coliseum on Tuesday, reviewing Trout's game film for an episode of "Big Sticks with Ken Griffey Jr." on FOX Sports 1, which will air at some point during the American League Division Series.
item.content:encoded: Mike Trout and Ken Griffey Jr. sat down for about a half hour at one of the family rooms at O.co Coliseum on Tuesday, reviewing Trout's game film for an episode of "Big Sticks with Ken Griffey Jr." on FOX Sports 1, which will air at some point during the American League Division Series.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Clock is ticking for Shoemaker, Hamilton
item.description: Injured Angels Matt Shoemaker and Josh Hamilton reported continued progress on Tuesday night in Oakland, but their status for the American League Division Series didn't get any clearer.
item.content:encoded: Injured Angels Matt Shoemaker and Josh Hamilton reported continued progress on Tuesday night in Oakland, but their status for the American League Division Series didn't get any clearer.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Wilson gets hook in first as Angels fall to A's
item.description: The Angels lost to the A's, 8-4, on Monday night in Oakland, but game outcomes aren't necessarily important this week. Most prevalent in the American League West champions' minds is likely how badly C.J. Wilson struggled.
item.content:encoded: The Angels lost to the A's, 8-4, on Monday night in Oakland, but game outcomes aren't necessarily important this week. Most prevalent in the American League West champions' minds is likely how badly C.J. Wilson struggled.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Morris 'flattered' by interview for D-backs' GM opening
item.description: Longtime Reds first baseman Hal Morris, like most retired hitters, still feels most comfortable on the field, "around the batting cage." But he's transitioned into a front-office role, currently finishing his third season as the Angels' director of pro scouting and recently being a candidate to be the D-backs' new general manager.
item.content:encoded: Longtime Reds first baseman Hal Morris, like most retired hitters, still feels most comfortable on the field, "around the batting cage." But he's transitioned into a front-office role, currently finishing his third season as the Angels' director of pro scouting and recently being a candidate to be the D-backs' new general manager.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Pujols out at first base as call is overturned
item.description: The Rangers won a big challenge in the bottom of the eighth inning of their 2-1 win against the Angels on Sunday.
item.content:encoded: The Rangers won a big challenge in the bottom of the eighth inning of their 2-1 win against the Angels on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: T.R. Sullivan

item.title: Late homer by Rangers sinks Angels in home finale
item.description: Ryan Rua's ninth-inning solo home run off Huston Street lifted the Rangers to a 2-1 win on Sunday afternoon at Angel Stadium.
item.content:encoded: Ryan Rua's ninth-inning solo home run off Huston Street lifted the Rangers to a 2-1 win on Sunday afternoon at Angel Stadium.
item.dc:creator: Matthew DeFranks

item.title: Angels' postseason roster far from set
item.description: The Angels don't have any high-stress games remaining this season, but that doesn't mean some of the players don't have something to prove.
item.content:encoded: The Angels don't have any high-stress games remaining this season, but that doesn't mean some of the players don't have something to prove.
item.dc:creator: Matthew DeFranks

item.title: Halos get past Rangers on strength of HRs, Weaver
item.description: Mike Trout, Albert Pujols and David Freese each homered as the Angels snapped a brief two-game losing streak with an 8-5 win over Texas on Saturday night at Angel Stadium. Jered Weaver earned the win in a quality start of seven-plus innings pitched to become the AL's first 18-game winner.
item.content:encoded: Mike Trout, Albert Pujols and David Freese each homered as the Angels snapped a brief two-game losing streak with an 8-5 win over Texas on Saturday night at Angel Stadium. Jered Weaver earned the win in a quality start of seven-plus innings pitched to become the AL's first 18-game winner.
item.dc:creator: Matthew DeFranks

item.title: Santiago struggles, can't halt Rangers' streak
item.description: Hector Santiago struggled for the second straight start and his offense struggled to solve Lisalverto Bonilla as the Angels lost, 12-3, to the Rangers on Friday night at Angel Stadium.
item.content:encoded: Hector Santiago struggled for the second straight start and his offense struggled to solve Lisalverto Bonilla as the Angels lost, 12-3, to the Rangers on Friday night at Angel Stadium.
item.dc:creator: Matthew DeFranks

item.title: Three million in attendance surpassed for 12th straight season
item.description: The Angels surpassed 3 million in attendance for the season on Friday night for the 12th consecutive season -- a feat matched only by the Yankees.
item.content:encoded: The Angels surpassed 3 million in attendance for the season on Friday night for the 12th consecutive season -- a feat matched only by the Yankees.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Three-man rotation being considered for ALDS
item.description: For the first time on Thursday, the Angels' coaching staff went over their potential 25-man roster for the five-game American League Division Series that kicks off from Angel Stadium in a couple of weeks.
item.content:encoded: For the first time on Thursday, the Angels' coaching staff went over their potential 25-man roster for the five-game American League Division Series that kicks off from Angel Stadium in a couple of weeks.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Angels motivated to win for injured teammate Richards
item.description: Some pundits thought Garrett Richards' season-ending knee injury would bury the Angels. Instead, it brought them closer together.
item.content:encoded: Some pundits thought Garrett Richards' season-ending knee injury would bury the Angels. Instead, it brought them closer together.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: LeBlanc, reserves edged out by Felix, Mariners
item.description: The Wild Card-contending Mariners and their ace were supposed to steamroll the Angels' second-stringers and their replacement journeyman starting pitcher. Instead, Wade LeBlanc held his own against Felix Hernandez before Seattle won a battle of the bullpens, 3-1, at Angel Stadium.
item.content:encoded: The Wild Card-contending Mariners and their ace were supposed to steamroll the Angels' second-stringers and their replacement journeyman starting pitcher. Instead, Wade LeBlanc held his own against Felix Hernandez before Seattle won a battle of the bullpens, 3-1, at Angel Stadium.
item.dc:creator: Matthew DeFranks

item.title: Angels ride determination back to the top
item.description: This was an American League West title built on perseverance and resilience. Oh sure, you hear every division champion say this kind of stuff. The only thing is, these Angels walked the walk.
item.content:encoded: This was an American League West title built on perseverance and resilience. Oh sure, you hear every division champion say this kind of stuff. The only thing is, these Angels walked the walk.
item.dc:creator: Richard Justice

item.title: Wilson finds form for Angels at just right time
item.description: The Angels officially clinched the AL West title late Wednesday night, but that became inevitable long ago. The most encouraging part was how they did it -- with C.J. Wilson dominating for the first time in a long time.
item.content:encoded: The Angels officially clinched the AL West title late Wednesday night, but that became inevitable long ago. The most encouraging part was how they did it -- with C.J. Wilson dominating for the first time in a long time.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Angels have pedigree to go all the way
item.description: Teams have continually overcome rotation shortcomings to win it all, and there are so many reasons to feel good about the 2014 Angels as they march toward October. Here are five reasons they can win the World Series.
item.content:encoded: Teams have continually overcome rotation shortcomings to win it all, and there are so many reasons to feel good about the 2014 Angels as they march toward October. Here are five reasons they can win the World Series.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez

item.title: Back on top: Angels reclaim AL West title
item.description: After a four-year playoff drought, the Angels reclaimed the title they held for the majority of the 2000s on Wednesday night, first by beating the Mariners, 5-0, and then by watching as the A's lose to the Rangers, 6-1, in Oakland.
item.content:encoded: After a four-year playoff drought, the Angels reclaimed the title they held for the majority of the 2000s on Wednesday night, first by beating the Mariners, 5-0, and then by watching as the A's lose to the Rangers, 6-1, in Oakland.
item.dc:creator: Alden Gonzalez
